abstract: The Obama adviser David Plouffe takes aim at what he calls Mitt Romney's convenient positioning on key issues.

lead_paragraph: David Plouffe, a senior adviser to President Obama and one of the chief architects of his 2008 victory, accused Mitt Romney of trimming his views for political gain and lacking the conviction needed to hold high office. The comments were unusual for their harsh assessment of Mr. Romney's politics and his character at this early stage of the campaign and for the fact that they came from an official serving in the White House rather than in Mr. Obama's Chicago-based re-election campaign.
